abstract: Bank of America, which is trying to avoid paying billions of dollars in fees for government guarantees against losses at Merrill Lynch, saying the rescue agreement was never signed, ought to pay up, Breakingviews says.
snippet: Bank of America, which is trying to avoid paying billions of dollars in fees for government guarantees against losses at Merrill Lynch, saying the rescue agreement was never signed, ought to pay up, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth Lewis needs to get out his checkbook, Breakingviews.com says.

headline.main: How Much Should BofA Pay for Uncle Sam’s Embrace?
